data.name: Atgeirmaðr
data.description:
Infantry best used against mounted units. Attacks faster with nearby Varangians.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
+ Additional damage against Elephants
- Weak against armored infantry
- Countered by Archers

data.name: Attack Ship
data.description:
Ship equipped with broadside ballistae.
+ Strong against Arrow Ships
- Lower maneuverability

data.name: Bogmaðr
data.description:
Ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets. Has an ability to pierce enemy armor for reduced move speed.
+ High rate of fire
- Weak against armored targets
- Countered by Horsemen

data.name: Veteran Bogmaðr
data.description:
Ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets. Has an ability to pierce enemy armor for reduced move speed.
+ High rate of fire
- Weak against armored targets
- Countered by Horsemen

data.description:
Ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets. Has an ability to pierce enemy armor for reduced move speed.

data.name: Bombard
data.description:
Intimidating siege gun excellent against buildings or any stubborn targets.
+ High damage
- Must be set up to fire

data.name: Elite Cataphract
data.description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and melee armor. Effective against melee units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

data.name: Cheirosiphon
data.description:
Durable infantry transport equipped with Greek Fire, effective against Buildings and Walls.
+ Greek Fire persists on ground
+ High ranged armor
+ High health
- Only attacks buildings
- Slow move speed

data.name: Counterweight Trebuchet
data.description:
Powerful siege engine effective at destroying buildings and walls over a great distance.
+ Bonus damage vs buildings
- Must be set up to fire
- Inaccurate against units

data.name: Crossbowman
data.description:
High damage ranged unit best against heavy targets.
+ Anti-heavy specialist
- Low health
- Countered by Horsemen

data.name: Elite Crossbowman
data.description:
High damage ranged unit best against heavy targets.
+ Anti-heavy specialist
- Low health
- Countered by Horsemen

data.name: Demolition Ship
data.description:
Small ship packed with explosives. Detonates when killed, damaging any units in the area.
- Damage is reduced further from the explosion center
- No weapons other than self-destruction

data.name: Dromon
data.description:
Military ship equipped a flamethrower that can be upgraded to use Greek Fire.
+ Strong against Arrow Ships
- Low weapon range
- Countered by Demolition Ships

data.name: Fishing Boat
data.description:
Small boat that gathers Food from either Deep Water Fish or Shoreline Fish. Drops off gathered resources at the Dock.
+ Can repair
- No combat

data.name: Galley
data.description:
Oared war vessel armed with a crew of archers.
+ Increased maneuverability
+ Benefits from ranged damage Blacksmith technology

data.name: Handcannoneer
data.description:
Powerful all-purpose ranged infantry.
+ High damage
- High cost
- Slow movement speed
- Countered by Horsemen

data.name: Hippodrome Horseman
data.description:
Fast cavalry that enhances damage of nearby cavalry.
+ High movement speed
+ Health regeneration
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

data.name: Hippodrome Riddari
data.description:
Elite varangian cavalry that can enhance the movement speed of nearby infantry. 
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

data.name: Hippodrome Scout
data.description:
Lightly armed cavalry with increased vision and damage. Comes with an aura that increases damage of torches.
+ Able to see into Stealth Forests
+ Health regeneration
+ High movement speed
- Very weak in combat

data.name: Horseman
data.description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units.
+ High movement speed
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

data.name: Veteran Horseman
data.description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units.
+ High movement speed
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

data.name: Elite Horseman
data.description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units.
+ High movement speed
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

data.name: Huihui Pao
data.description:
Massive siege engine with incredible range, extra effective at destroying buildings and walls.
+ Extremely long range
- Must be set up to fire

data.name: Mangonel
data.description:
Fires multiple projectiles dealing damage in an area.
+ Effective against massed units
- Must be set up to fire

data.name: Monk
data.description:
Support unit with no combat capability. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites.
+ Heals friendly units
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Nest of Bees
data.description:
Innovative field weapon capable of firing a barrage of rockets to damage defensive positions and clumped enemy troops.
+ Good area of effect damage against most targets
- Slowest movement speed
- Weak if surrounded

data.name: Riddari
data.description:
Cavalry with high damage and melee armor. Has an ability to throw axes from range.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

data.name: Elite Riddari
data.description:
Cavalry with high damage and melee armor. Has an ability to throw axes from range.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

data.name: Royal Cannon
data.description:
Most powerful siege cannon. Excellent against buildings or any stubborn targets.
+ Bonus damage to buildings

data.name: Scout
data.description:
Lightly armed cavalry effective at exploring the world, hunting wildlife, and herding Sheep.
+ Able to see into Stealth Forests
+ Health regeneration
+ High movement speed
- Very weak in combat

data.name: Siege Tower
data.description:
Tall infantry transport with no combat capability. Allows garrisoned infantry to be unloaded directly onto Stone Walls.
+ High ranged armor
- Cannot attack
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Springald
data.description:
Anti-unit siege weapon. Fires bolts that pierce multiple units.
+ Does not require setup to fire
+ Bonus damage vs. melee infantry
- Trivial damage vs. buildings

data.name: Trade Ship
data.description:
Trade Ships generate Gold and Wood when assigned to a trade route with a Coastal Trade Post or another player's Dock.
- No combat

data.name: Trader
data.description:
Traders generate Gold by travelling between their Home Market and a Trade Post or another player's Market. Greater distances between the Home Market and trade destination will generate higher amounts of Gold.
The Home Market or Trade destination may be changed at any time.

data.name: Transport Ship
data.description:
Large oared vessel able to transport land units across water.
+ Can be garrisoned by any unit
+ Uses sight range of units in garrison
- No combat

data.name: Early Varangian Guard
data.description:
Tough infantry with good damage. Can use Berserking to increase damage for reduced armor.
+ Heavy armor
+ Increases armor of Transports
+ Disembarking from Transport Ships grants move speed
+ Increased armor near allied Wonders
- Slow move speed
- Countered by Crossbowmen

data.name: Villager
data.description:
Gathers Wood, Food, Stone, and Gold. Builds and repairs buildings and can repair siege engines and naval units.
- Weak in combat

data.name: Warship
data.description:
Large sailed war vessel armed with broadside cannons.
+ Anti-structure specialist
- Low movement speed
